node.title: Your Friday Briefing
node.description: Omicron in the U.K.

node.title: Forestry operators hope for recovery after 'perfect storm' hits log prices
node.description: Forestry contractors are bracing for a tough summer as they wait for log prices to recover and harvesting to regain momentum.

node.title: WHO warns against rich countries hoarding vaccines
node.description: The World Health Organisation warned wealthy countries against hoarding Covid-19 vaccines for booster shots as they try to fight off the new Omicron variant.

node.title: Earth Is Getting a ‘Black Box’ to Hold Humans Accountable for Climate Change
node.description: When a plane crashes, its flight recorder is critical to piecing together the missteps that led to calamity. Now the planet is getting its own in case it self-destructs.

node.title: Columbus Reaches $5.75 Million Settlement Agreement With Protesters
node.description: Under the deal, which is subject to City Council approval, the money would go to 32 plaintiffs who said they were injured by the police during 2020 social justice protests.

node.title: GOP and Democrats Agree on One Thing: Parents Should Be Charged for Kids' Gun Crimes
node.description: It's quite rare for parents to face criminal charges when their children commit crimes using their firearms.

node.title: Lyft will let employees work remotely for all of 2022
node.description: Another virus wave and uncertainty over the Omicron variant is throwing a wrench in companies' office return plans.

node.title: Judge: Enforcement Mechanism of Texas Abortion Law is Unconstitutional But Near-Ban Remains
node.description: "It is quite another thing to incentivize citizens or persons to file suits against other private citizens to extract money from them..." Davis Peeples wrote.

node.title: Head of California Medical Board Kristina Lawson Says Anti-Vaxxers Followed Her to Work
node.description: Lawson said four men in a car followed her from her home to a parking garage near her law office, and confronted her in the dark garage at the end of the day.

node.title: Police Say Car Was Intentionally Driven Into Niagara River, Leading to Dangerous Rescue
node.description: Police said the unidentified woman in her late 60s who died in the car appears to have driven into the river on purpose, and the investigation is ongoing.

node.title: Māori beneficiaries facing higher weekly debt repayments to MSD
node.description: Women and Māori beneficiaries are having to pay back their debt to the Ministry of Social Development at a higher rate than their male and Pākehā counterparts.

node.title: U.S. Announces End to Combat Mission in Iraq, but Troops Will Not Leave
node.description: The U.S. military said it had transitioned to an advise and assist mission in the country, but the roughly 2,500 service members on the ground will remain, staying on in support roles.

node.title: NYC Approves Bill to Allow Roughly 800K Green Card Holders to Vote in Municipal Elections
node.description: Over a dozen communities in the U.S. have already given non-citizens the right to vote in local elections, including 11 towns in Maryland and two in Vermont.

node.title: Lawmakers to hold ex-Trump chief of staff in contempt
node.description: Former White House chief of staff Mark Meadows has also sued the 6 January committee members.

node.title: Epiha jail term fourth equal in New Zealand's list of harshest sentences
node.description: Eli Epiha who admitted murdering police officer Matthew Hunt has been sentenced to one of the longest minimum non-parole periods imposed in New Zealand's legal history.

node.title: Government to overhaul conservation laws: 'We are at a defining moment for nature'
node.description: The government has unveiled a roadmap to overhaul antiquated and inadequate conservation laws while stepping up plans to address long-standing problems in the short term.

node.title: Truck crash in Mexico kills at least 49 people and injures 58
node.description: The victims appeared to be immigrants from Central America, though their nationalities had not yet been confirmed.

node.title: 'Robbery in the Skies': Dems Revive Bill to Regulate Airline Fees for Bags, Family Seats
node.description: The bill would allow the Department of Transportation to regulate fees to ensure they are "reasonable and proportional" to the cost imposed on the airline.

node.title: Lynlee Renick Convicted of Killing Snake-Breeder Husband to Collect His Life Insurance
node.description: Lynlee Renick was the sole beneficiary of a life-insurance policy for her husband amounting to $1 million and was having financial issues, prosecutors said.

node.title: Spotlight still shining on Black Caps spinner Ajaz Patel
node.description: It's almost been a week since Ajaz Patel wrote himself into the cricketing history books.

node.title: Diet Paratha: The community platform championing South Asian creatives
node.description: Anita Chhiba, the creative force behind an online platform championing South Asian culture, says the beauty of the platform is that it showcases South Asian people "free of cultural restraints".

node.title: Matthew Hunt's mother: 'He was only 28, he had his whole life ahead of him'
node.description: The mother of slain police officer Matthew Hunt says she wanted to face her son's killer in court for his cruel and callous actions.

node.title: FedEx poised to ship 100 million more packages this holiday season
node.description: The holiday rush comes as the shipping giant marks one year since transporting the first COVID vaccine.

node.title: Alex Murdaugh now facing more than 50 charges
node.description: Indictments filed Thursday allege Alex Murdaugh stole nearly $1.4 million.

node.title: Review: In a Gender-Flipped Revival, ‘Company’ Loves Misery
node.description: Bobby is now Bobbie in this confusing, sour remake of the 1970 musical by Stephen Sondheim and George Furth.

node.title: Rain-Soaked Rural Australia Asks: When Will It End?
node.description: After years of climate extremes, even the toughest, most community-minded Australians are desperate for a break from the deluge of disaster.

node.title: Taiwan Loses Nicaragua as Ally as Tensions With China Rise
node.description: The nation switched diplomatic allegiance to Beijing, leaving 13 nations and the Vatican still recognizing Taiwan as a sovereign nation.

node.title: 'Stop the Steal' Organizer Ali Alexander Served With Civil Suit After Meeting With 1/6 Panel
node.description: Video shows a man serving a summons to the rally organizer after he gave a closed-door deposition to Capitol riot investigators.

node.title: Joe Biden, Kamala Harris Tweets Backing Jussie Smollett Remain Up After Guilty Verdict
node.description: "This was an attempted modern day lynching," Harris wrote in her tweet.

node.title: JauMarcus McFarland's Mom Files Lawsuit After He's Crushed to Death by Elevator
node.description: The wrongful death lawsuit was filed against the owners of the building, three local elevator maintenance companies and the school McFarland was attending.
